io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock

Interface StockDownloader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StockFileDownloader, YahooStockDownloader

    public interface StockDownloader
    API for module for downloading stock data from a web service. Implementations of this interface should be tailored for the service it connects to.

    IMPLEMENTATION NOTES:

    1) The downloadStockDetails() requires the symbol of the stock it's getting information from, and an array of the names of the fields that it is downloading information for. The fields should all be constant values from the AbstractStock class to ensure consistency. It returns a Map of the constant field names (keys) and raw downloaded information (values).

    2) Because not all online services will offer the same information, downloadStockDetails() should check the field names and throw an IllegalArgumentException if any of the fields requested are not supported by the service. Implementations should not feel obligated to service each and every field with a constant name in the AbstractStock class if it would prevent a particular service from being used.

    3) Because not all field names from AbstractStock may be used in StockDownloader implementations, subclasses should clearly document which fields are accepted in their program.

    4) Both the downloadStockDetails() and downloadStockHistory() methods should perform some sort of check on whether or not the stock they are searching for is a valid stock. If not, they should throw an InvalidStockException.

    5) The downloadStockHistory() method should be used to retrieve historical information about the stock over a set period of months (specified by the parameter value). It returns a list of HistoricalQuote objects containing the date of the quote and the closing price of the stock on that day.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    AbstractStock

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> downloadStockDetails(java.lang.String symbol, java.lang.String[] fields)
      Downloads detailed data on a stock and returns it in a Map collection.
      java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> downloadStockHistory(java.lang.String symbol, int months)
      Downloads the history of this stock, and returns it as a list of HistoricalQuote objects.

    • Method Detail

      • downloadStockDetails

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> downloadStockDetails(java.lang.String symbol,
                                                                      java.lang.String[] fields)
                                                               throws InvalidStockException,
                                                                      java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                                      java.io.IOException
        Downloads detailed data on a stock and returns it in a Map collection. Accepts the stock's marketplace symbol and an array of names of the fields to be downloaded.

        The field names should be the constant values found in the AbstractStock class to maintain consistency. Implementations should not be bound to utilize each and every constant that exists, however if it does not there should be a check on the field names provided to ensure that they are supported. If they are not supported, an IllegalArgumentException should be thrown.

        In addition, the stock should be checked early on to ensure that it is a legitimate stock on the market. If it is not, an InvalidStockException should be thrown.

        Additional exceptions may be thrown based on various errors that may occur during execution. Implementing classes should document these exceptions so they can be anticipated.

        Parameters:
        symbol - the stock's marketplace symbol.
        fields - an array of constant values from the AbstractStock class defining the fields this class should download data for.
        Returns:
        a Map containing the data for the requested fields for the stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one or more of the fields data is requested for is not supported by the downloader.
        InvalidStockException - if the stock is not a legitimate marketplace stock.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web service.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download data from the web service.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock

      • downloadStockHistory

        java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> downloadStockHistory(java.lang.String symbol,
                                                     int months)
                                              throws InvalidStockException,
                                                     java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                     java.io.IOException
        Downloads the history of this stock, and returns it as a list of HistoricalQuote objects. The time period to get the history for is defined by a number of months passed as a parameter.

        The stock should be checked early on to ensure that it is a legitimate stock on the market. If it is not, an InvalidStockException should be thrown.

        Additional exceptions may be thrown based on various errors that may occur during execution. Implementing classes should document these exceptions so they can be anticipated.

        Parameters:
        symbol - the stock's marketplace symbol.
        months - the number of months to download history for.
        Returns:
        a list of HistoricalQuotes for the history of the stock.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if the stock is not a legitimate marketplace stock.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web service.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download data from the web service.
